bioghist.p: Langdon Elwyn Mitchell (1862-1935) was an American playwright, son of S. Weir Mitchell and grandson of John Kearsley Mitchell. Born in Philadelphia, he studied in Dresden and Paris, attended the Harvard and Columbia law schools, and was admitted to the New York bar in 1886. He wrote under the pen name of John Philip Varley.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two manuscripts: the first is a typescript of "Ancestry of Kenneth MacKenzie and Helena Mary Langdon (Mitchell) Day" by George Valentine Massey II, 1965; the other is a handwritten manuscript of a drama entitled "The Return of Ulysses" by Langdon Elwyn Mitchell, 1889, which includes Mitchell's notes on music to accompany the drama.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
